alert.note: Alert for Hood (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 14 at 1:27AM CDT until further notice by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Texas and north central Texas, including the following counties, in central Texas, Bosque. In north central Texas, Erath, Hood, Palo Pinto, Parker and Somervell. * WHEN...Until 430 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Granbury, Glen Rose, Brock, Meridian, Lipan, Iredell, Dinosaur Valley State Park, Squaw Creek Reservoir, Bluff Dale, Oak Trail Shores, Morgan Mill, Meridian State Park, Lake Palo Pinto, Walnut Springs, Horseshoe Bend, Tolar, Morgan, Millsap, Cedar Shores and New Salem.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
